ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: For those who have some interest in innovation, this would be a great class to take.

I have already recommended this course to my classmates. It is a great opportunity to work with students from other professional schools, to work on a substantive topic, and to do so in a manner that explores process-based planning that will be widely applicable.
Yes. I would highly recommend the course to any and all students. I would also suggest expanding the membership beyond SOM, Law, and Jackson to possibly include 5 students from "wildcard" schools.
I would definitely recommend. The class makes students touch the frontier of initiatives involving innovations in government and opens our minds to think how government should operate.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class allows me to think innovation from the perspective that I did not have.
The best practice-based learning experience I've had at Yale. I hope to take further courses like this in the future.
The course helped me explore not only cases of innovations in governments, but the processes and requirements necessary to implement innovations that generate social good.
